item.description:
Join members and friends of the MoonPool Coven for our Bi-Monthly Celebration and Discussion group. This is a wonderfully enriching, educational and fun circle. Learn about different ways of celebrating the turns of the Wheel of the Year, meet new people and learn to share personal experiences, stories, laughter and joy in the spirit of the seasons!

All activities at the UU Church of Haverhill, 15 Kenoza Ave Haverhill, MA 01830

Free-will donations and non-perishable food items for the Church are appreciated as are appropriate snacks to share with the group.

OPEN CIRCLE: 7PM - the Storm Moon
The Storm Moon represents the connection between the Moon's energy and the creative, unpredictable Aquarius. The Storm Moon reflects the intense creative change the year is undergoing. Like the Storm that destroys plant life before it recreates it, the Storm Moon's intense energy should be recognized and viewed as constructive.

Open Class and Discussion, 6PM - History of Witchcraft

One figure, above all, has haunted the human imagination since humans began to imagine: the witch. Witchcraft seems always to have been with us, but the curious will ask: where did it come from and where is it going?
Anthropologists often define witchcraft as “the use of malevolent powers by psychic means without the need for ritual or charm”. This may have been so for the days of the Inquisition but not for the contemporary western world where witches work magic through spells.
This class provides a historical overview of how modern-day magic evolved from early man, the beliefs and customs of the Celts, and other ancient, Indo-European peoples.
item.name: Class & Open Circle - the Storm Moon
